purpleculture_pinyin:
zhēng
to open (one's eyes)
открыть (глаза)
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 睁)
Pictophonetic: 爭 indicates the sound; 目 (eye) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
睜眼 [ zhēng yǎn ]: to open one's eyes
睜眼說瞎話 [ zhēng yǎn shuō xiā huà ]: to lie through one's teeth (idiom); to talk drivel
睜著眼睛說瞎話 [ zhēng zhe yǎn jīng shuō xiā huà ]: to lie through one's teeth (idiom); to talk drivel
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 目 [ mù ] eye; to look, to see; division, topic
    • 爭 [ zhēng ] to dispute, to fight, to contend, to strive
heisig_chinese_memo: I was trying to get to sleep, contending with my eyeballs, but they remained unshut all night until I finally fell asleep in the morning.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: You try to make your partner happy by contending with your eyes to make them unshut during that painfully boring romance movie.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " head " to the sound of " striving ". The original meaning is to open your eyes. Such as Feng Menglong of the Ming Dynasty "Awakening the World Heng Yan. "Chen Duoshou Life and Death Couple": "(Duo Fu) opened his eyes, saw his parents in front, and burst into tears." Qing Dynasty Cao Xueqin's "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 3: "What book did I read, but I recognized two Words, it's not a blind man with his eyes open!"

"Keep open" also means looking straight at the eyes. For example, Wu Chengen's "Journey to the West" Chapter 5 of the Ming Dynasty: "This turned out to be a fixation method. All the seven-dressed fairies were standing under the peach tree with eyes open." Wu Jingzi in Qing Dynasty "Outside History" Chapter 24: "This monk was gathering firewood in the mountains and saw many cows put away by others. One of the cows inside saw the monk and only looked at him with his eyes open."

" Open " also means to see and look. For example, the fourth chapter of Tao Zhenhuai's "Tianyuhua" in the Qing Dynasty: "Unfortunately, he turned back, and did not dare to come forward and rush to the side.
humanum_short_description_en: From the " head " to the sound of " striving ". The original meaning is to open your eyes.
humanum_full_description:
從「目」，「爭」聲。本義是張開眼睛。如明代馮夢龍《醒世恒言．陳多壽生死夫妻》：「（多福）睜開雙眼，看見爹媽在前，放聲大哭。」清代曹雪芹《紅樓夢》第3回：「讀的是什麼書，不過是認得兩個字，不是睜眼的瞎子罷了！」

　　「睜睜」也表示眼睛直視的樣子。如明代吳承恩《西遊記》第5回：「這原來是個定身法，把那七衣仙女，一個個睖睖睜睜，白著眼，都站在桃樹之下。」清代吳敬梓《儒林外史》第24回：「這和尚因在山中拾柴，看見人家放的許多牛，內中有一條牛見這和尚，把兩眼睜睜的只望着他。」

　　「睜」還表示看、望。如清代陶貞懷《天雨花》第4回：「偏偏他卻轉回程，不敢上前來衝道，閃在傍邊仔細睜。」
humanum_short_description: 從「目」，「爭」聲。本義是張開眼睛。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
睜 (Simplified: 睁)
Pinyin: zhēng
English Definition: to open (one's eyes)
Total strokes: 13; Radical: 目
Pictophonetic: 爭 indicates the sound; 目 (eye) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 目 [ mù ] eye; to look, to see; division, topic
    • 爭 [ zhēng ] to dispute, to fight, to contend, to strive
Example Words:
睜眼 [ zhēng yǎn ]: to open one's eyes
睜眼說瞎話 [ zhēng yǎn shuō xiā huà ]: to lie through one's teeth (idiom); to talk drivel
睜著眼睛說瞎話 [ zhēng zhe yǎn jīng shuō xiā huà ]: to lie through one's teeth (idiom); to talk drivel
More: 睜* | *睜 | *睜*

從「 目 」，「 爭 」聲。本義是張開眼睛。如明代馮夢龍《醒世恒言．陳多壽生死夫妻》：「（多福）睜開雙眼，看見爹媽在前，放聲大哭。」清代曹雪芹《紅樓夢》第3回：「讀的是什麼書，不過是認得兩個字，不是睜眼的瞎子罷了！」 「睜睜」也表示眼睛直視的樣子。如明代吳承恩《西遊記》第5回：「這原來是個定身法，把那七衣仙女，一個個睖睖睜睜，白著眼，都站在桃樹之下。」清代吳敬梓《儒林外史》第24回：「這和尚因在山中拾柴，看見人家放的許多牛，內中有一條牛見這和尚，把兩眼睜睜的只望着他。」 「 睜 」還表示看、望。如清代陶貞懷《天雨花》第4回：「偏偏他卻轉回程，不敢上前來衝道，閃在傍邊仔細睜。」

"Keep open" also means looking straight at the eyes. For example, Wu Chengen's "Journey to the West" Chapter 5 of the Ming Dynasty: "This turned out to be a fixation method. 睜字的基本解释

睜
zhēng
同“睁”。

睜字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhēng］
“睁1”的旧字形。

睜字的康熙字典解释

【午集中】【目字部】　睜； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页810第14
【廣韻】【集韻】?疾郢切，音穽。【字林】眳睜，不悅視也。或作睛。俗作睜。

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形

暂无。
